intro: Dracaena smithii, commonly known as the spiral dracaena, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to the island of Socotra, located in the Arabian Sea, and is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves. The plant has strap-shaped, dark green leaves that spiral upward from a central stem, creating an elegant, almost otherworldly appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are followed by red berries. Dracaena smithii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and ability to thrive in a variety of indoor conditions.
